title: Scorsese jokes that making a film with Netflix allowed a slower pace in the shooting schedule to suit his 'age group'
text:
Martin Scorsese has joked that making his latest film with Netflix allowed for a slower pace in the shooting schedule to suit a man in his seventies.

The 76-year-old eight-time Oscar nominee said that Hollywood studios would not finance his gangster epic The Irishman partly because of the large budget needed for the shoot and for the cost of the CGI technology used throughout the film.

Instead, streaming giant Netflix stepped forward and offered to finance The Irishman which reportedly had a budget of over $140million.

“The trade-off is no interference, full budget and a schedule that would allow for the CGI and, I have to say, the rhythm of the shoot to our age group,” he told an audience at the Royal Opera House on Saturday.

Robert De Niro and Al Pacino play their younger selves in flashbacks throughout the film through the use of CGI.

Scorsese said he did not want to use younger actors in the flashback scenes. “There were so many flashbacks and when I make a picture with [Robert] De Niro and Al [Pacino] and Joe [Pesci] I didn’t want to work with actors pretending to be them younger.

“Half the picture I’d have to explain [to the younger actors] who Frank Sinatra is! I mean, they know who Sinatra is but they don’t know who Sinatra is,” he said.
description: Martin Scorsese has joked that making his latest film with Netflix allowed for a slower pace in the shooting schedule to suit a man in his seventies.
